title.narrative: OUTPUT 2 - Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: By end of 2019, schools and health facilities in Mali have adequate and sustainable water and sanitation infrastructures, and improved hygiene conditions, especially in rural areas and areas affected by humanitarian situations., which contributes to Health Systems Strengthening, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [WASH]: By 2019, communities, particularly those living in rural and disadvantaged areas, have increased sustainable access to and use of safe drinking water, basic sanitation and hygiene, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2019, schools and health facilities in Mali have adequate and sustainable water and sanitation infrastructures, andimproved hygiene conditions, especially in rural areas and areas affected by humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF programme led to an improved enabling environment for water, sanitation and hygiene development in schools and health centers in Mali by accelerating efforts to institutionalize WASH interventions in the health and education sector, developing and refining evidence-based intervention models and reducing bottlenecks affecting the scaling up of services provided for the most deprived children and women. With UNICEF direct support in 2019, 95 schools reaching 15,145 children (7,024 girls, 8,121 boys) and 61 health centers gained access to improved water and gender-friendly sanitation facilities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/02/2020
